title: Police identify 16-year-old killed by fellow teen in Fairfield
content:
A teenager killed after an argument with another boy was identified Tuesday as a 16-year-old Fairfield resident.
Dominic Gilliam was shot Sunday night in a parking lot on the 2700 block of North Texas Street, police said. Paramedics rushed him to a nearby hospital, where he died.
The teenager who shot Gilliam fled the scene, police said. But several hours later, SWAT teams surrounded the suspect’s home on the 2000 block of Bristol Lane and took the alleged gunman into custody. He is also 16 years old.
Authorities haven’t said what motivated the killing, only that an argument broke out between the two and that they knew each other.
The suspect, who hasn’t been named because he’s a juvenile, is set to be arraigned Wednesday in Solano County Superior Court on murder and firearm charges, said District Attorney Krishna Abrams.
Officers are working to piece together the exact details of what led up to the shooting, including how the teenager got the gun, said Lt. Rob Lenke, a Fairfield police spokesman.
Kimberly Veklerov is a San Francisco Chronicle staff writer. Email: kveklerov@sfchronicle.com Twitter: @kveklerov
